summary: This is the Metropolitan Correctional Center's Daily Activity Report and Lieutenant's Log for August 10-11, 2019, documenting the shift activities and the medical emergency involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was found unresponsive in his cell and transported to a hospital.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054 found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) in the Special Housing Unit at approximately 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019. CPR was performed, and he was transported to an outside hospital.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: The shift supervisor who authored the log, reporting on institutional counts, equipment checks, and the medical emergency involving Epstein.

persons.name: Mutimura
persons.context: Inmate #76329-054 who was transferred to a special housing dry cell on August 9, 2019, at 3:58 PM.

connections.description: The Operations Lieutenant was the supervising officer responsible for the facility and documented the medical emergency response for inmate Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: At approximately 6:33 AM, inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was found unresponsive in cell Z06-220 in the Special Housing Unit. CPR was initiated, 911 was called, and he was transported by EMS to a local hospital with CPR continuing en route.

events.title: Inmate Transfer to Dry Cell
events.description: Inmate Mutimura (#76329-054) was transferred to a special housing dry cell at 3:58 PM.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) in the Special Housing Unit at approximately 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019.
CPR was performed on Epstein at the scene and continued by EMTs during transport to a local hospital via ambulance, which arrived at the facility at 6:43 AM.
The Control Center Fire Panel was reported as inoperative at the beginning of the Morning Watch shift on August 10.
The log indicates staffing shortages led to vacated correctional assignments for sanitation and the 10 South #2 post.
The document is a confidential internal prison log detailing routine operations and the emergency response to Epstein's medical incident.
